## Entrada de dados no R

## Carregando dados




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(qcc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> Package 'qcc' version 2.7
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> Type 'citation("qcc")' for citing this R package in publications.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
#> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
#> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
#> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
#> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
#> ✔ purrr     1.0.2
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ purrr::%||%()   masks base::%||%()
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
#> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
data(pistonrings)
```
:::




## Explorando os dados




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(pistonrings)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>   diameter sample trial
#> 1   74.030      1  TRUE
#> 2   74.002      1  TRUE
#> 3   74.019      1  TRUE
#> 4   73.992      1  TRUE
#> 5   74.008      1  TRUE
#> 6   73.995      2  TRUE
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(pistonrings)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>     diameter         sample        trial        
#>  Min.   :73.97   Min.   : 1.00   Mode :logical  
#>  1st Qu.:74.00   1st Qu.:10.75   FALSE:75       
#>  Median :74.00   Median :20.50   TRUE :125      
#>  Mean   :74.00   Mean   :20.50                  
#>  3rd Qu.:74.01   3rd Qu.:30.25                  
#>  Max.   :74.04   Max.   :40.00
```


:::
:::




## Manipulando os dados




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
aneisdepistao <- pistonrings %>% 
  rename(diametro = diameter, amostra = sample, fase1 = trial)
```
:::




## Visualizando os dados




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
media <- aneisdepistao %>% filter(fase1==T) %>% group_by(amostra) %>% summarise(media = mean(diametro))

ggplot(media, aes(x = amostra, y = media)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Diâmetro médio dos anéis de pistão",
       x = "Amostra",
       y = "Diâmetro")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
aneisdepistao %>% filter(fase1==T) %>% ggplot(aes(x = as.factor(amostra), y = diametro)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Box-Plots dos diametros dos anéis de pistão",
       x = "Amostra",
       y = "Diâmetro")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::




## Resumo dos dados




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dlookr)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'dlookr':
#>   method          from  
#>   plot.transform  scales
#>   print.transform scales
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> 
#> Anexando pacote: 'dlookr'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> O seguinte objeto é mascarado por 'package:tidyr':
#> 
#>     extract
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> O seguinte objeto é mascarado por 'package:base':
#> 
#>     transform
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
diagnose_numeric(aneisdepistao)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>   variables    min     Q1    mean median    Q3    max zero minus outlier
#> 1  diametro 73.967 73.995 74.0036 74.003 74.01 74.036    0     0       3
#> 2   amostra  1.000 10.750 20.5000 20.500 30.25 40.000    0     0       0
```


:::
:::




## Histograma




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(aneisdepistao, aes(x = diametro)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = round(1+3.322*log10(nrow(aneisdepistao)),0), fill = "blue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Histograma dos diâmetros dos anéis de pistão",
       x = "Diâmetro",
       y = "Frequência")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::
